intro: Phlomoides stellata, commonly known as starry phlomis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, star-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming in summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Phlomoides stellata thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
